#summary Getting started with the NLog target FireDotNet
#labels Featured,Phase-Implementation,Phase-Deploy

= Requirements =

  * [http://getfirefox.com Firefox] with [http://getfirebug.com/ Firebug] and [http://www.firephp.org/ FirePHP]
  * NLog (included in the archive)
  * You should already know how NLog works (be able to log to the console or a file)

= Configuration =

First of all you have to deploy the NLog.Targets.FireDotNet.dll together with the NLog.dll file.

To be able to debug to the Firebug console you have to make a few small adjustments to your NLog configuration: (NLog.config)
  # you should add an extensions section in the nlog section like this:
{{{
<extensions>
  <add assembly="NLog.Targets.FireDotNet"/>
</extensions> 
}}}
  # you should add a target of the type FireDotNet:
{{{
<target name="a1" type="FireDotNet" />
}}}
  # and add a logger that writes to the target e.g.
{{{
<logger name="*" minLevel="Trace" appendTo="a1"/>
}}}

your complete configuration file might look like this:
{{{
<nlog xmlns="http://www.nlog-project.org/schemas/NLog.xsd" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <extensions>
    <add assembly="NLog.Targets.FireDotNet"/>
  </extensions>
  <targets>
    <target name="firebugconsole" type="FireDotNet" />
  </targets>
  <rules>
    <logger name="*" minLevel="DEBUG" appendTo="firebugconsole"/>
  </rules>
</nlog>
}}}
